definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to storm off in a huff (idiom)
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle

sentences.english: The warm wind blew the bead curtain against the table.
sentences.chinese: 热风把珠帘吹得拂到了桌子。

sentences.english: A breath, almost a respiration, moved the shrubbery .
sentences.chinese: 一阵弱如鼻息的气流拂着野草。

sentences.english: Whisk in semisweet chocolate until smooth.
sentences.chinese: 在半甜的巧克力拂直到光滑。

sentences.english: Wind from the water whisk past, the lotus stand upright in the water slightly to tremble with.
sentences.chinese: 风从水上拂过去，水中挺立的荷花微微地颤动着。

sentences.english: The high tide will erase my foot-prints, and the wind will blow away the foam.
sentences.chinese: 高涨的潮水抹去我的足迹，海风也将泡沫拂走。

sentences.english: Blend, chop and whisk with this ultra-versatile stick blender.
sentences.chinese: 交融，印章及与这种超多功能棒搅拌器拂。

sentences.english: Willow twigs caress my wine cup gently.
Cream the cheese with sugar. Beat well.
Gyokuro residual firefly habitat, early goose whisk Gold River.
sentences.chinese: 残萤栖玉露，早雁拂金河。

definition: (of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
delicate hands/woman's tender and soft hands
to swirl about/(of leaves and branches) to sway
to float in the air/swiftly/nimbly/easy and relaxed
